The only people I can think of that would have thick armor are mercenaries, and I already know the weak spots in their common armors. I’m good, but what’s next?
All right, here. Next up is a rare artifact, called the “Black Angel.” It helps you withstand a lot of psychic pressure from mutants and anomalies. You want it?
Yeah. This will *definitely* come in handy later.
I’m good. Anything else?

Here. That was the last thing in the box except for the ammo and medical supplies that Savage requested. I’ll let him divide it amongst the rest of the guys, who should be very pleased to have more than one mag on them at any given moment.
That’s fair. What was inside?
Uh, two packs of 5.45x39 7H22 armor piercing ammo with a hardened tungsten core. They’re designed to pierce armor up to class IIIA, drywall, thin metal barriers… You get the picture. You want it?
We’ve got a Black Angel artifact that helps you withstand psy-emissions and psychic pressure. Did you want it?
Great. See you later, Screw.

Well, first off was a Spetsnaz-issue 1PN58 night vision scope. Fits onto dovetail mounts and has a pretty clear image, no cracks, nothing. I manually zeroed it in and set it for three point five times zoom.
Sounds useful. Lemme get it.
Mosquito could put that to better use. I’ll pass.

Here you go. Next up is an FNP-45, perfect condition. Two or three aftermarket parts, but other than that, looks completely original. .45 ACP, big mag size, excellent accuracy and handling characteristics. Probably the best pistol you can get in the Zone without an arms dealer contact. You want it?
Hell yeah I want that! Pass it here.
Eh… Sidearms aren’t that important to me. What’s next?

That’s pretty fair. Next up though, is an FNP-45. Perfect condition, completely original parts. .45 ACP, big mag size, solid accuracy and handling characteristics and beats the hell out of that heavy SOCOM hunk of junk. One of the best sidearms in the whole Zone. You interested?
I found a toolkit. You interested?

Sure am. Pass it over here. Hmm… looks like they should be sufficient for basic work. They beat the hell out of this soviet mallet I was using before… thanks, Beast. I’ll be sure to give you special treatment and some lowered prices for this, heh.
Haha. Thanks, Screw.
Find those fucking assholes!
Hey, Beast, you still busy? Wanna help me out with a little errand?
What did you need?

We need to fix the radio transceiver in the basement. We should be able to fix it with a battery and about two rolls of copper wire. The copper wiring should be real easy to find, but the hard part is probably going to be finding a suitable battery with a charge. Your best bet would probably be looting it off another stalker or trading with someone who’s just come into this anomaly.\n \nIf you find anything, bring it here, please. The transceiver down there is pretty powerful, so we’ll probably be able to transmit outside of the anomaly. It’s looking like our only lead on a way out right now, so it’s pretty important that we get it working.
All right. I’ll keep an eye out for batteries and copper wire.
Not right now. Ask me again later, though.
You find anything?
Hey, Beast! I’m chilling down here now. I kind of like it down here, and I wanted to stay out of the others’ way.
Got a battery. Someone new came into the anomaly, and I traded him for it.
I’ve got the copper wire.
Unfortunate, but let’s hope his path ends up in a U-turn right out of this godforsaken place. It works, right?
It should. It came from another radio transceiver that broke on the way here, so it should match this one.
I think it will. He took it from a radio transceiver of his own that got broken on the way here. It should fit right into ours.
Okay… Yup. It fits right in. I just need the rolls of copper wiring so I can replace what got fried, and then I can try to restart it.

Okay, let’s see… Yeah, it looks fine to me. If I did it right, we should be able to get this thing started again. Come back in about twenty minutes, give or take, and I’ll let you know if it’s working.
All right. Sounds good to me.
Hey, Beast, I’ll talk to you later. Okay?
Well, that’s good news. Savage said you needed me for something. Everything okay?
Okay.
Hey there, Beast. You need something?
Oh hey, it’s you. Did you have any questions for me?
I’m all ears, Beast.
No. I’ve been looking pretty hard, too.
Excellent. All I need now is a battery and this thing will be working again.
Well, I’ll just have to keep looking, I guess.
Well, keep me updated and all that.
Okay. I’ll get busy looking again, so later.

Yeah, Beast. There’s a radio transceiver down here, and it’s pretty powerful. I studied radio technology when I was younger; minored in it, and I was pretty damn good with it. I think I can get it working again, but I need some spare parts first. If you can find me a suitable battery with a charge and some copper wire to replace the fried wiring, I’ll have a good chance of restarting this bad boy and maybe broadcasting an SOS signal to people outside of this anomaly.
Excellent! Give me about twenty minutes and I think I can get this beast working…
Sure. Let me know when you’re done and I’ll come back.
All right. I’ll try to find some.
Come back in a little while. I’m still trying to get this thing working.
I fixed it! I really fixed it…! All right, now let’s try to broadcast something…
Did you pick up on any outside signals while you were testing it?

Not really. Just some Soviet-era alert broadcasts that were turned on when the Scorcher was turned on. I’ll keep trying, though; you may have just saved us all with a battery and some copper wire, Beast!
God, I hope so.
A battery? I would have to get one off someone who had just entered the anomaly in order for it to still have any charge…
Well, I’m kind of busy right now. Let’s discuss that later.
Well, I’m just putting some options out there. The battery is the most important part, so we’ll just have to be vigilant. Just bring me the wire and battery if you find any.
All right, all right. It’s going straight to you if I manage to find any.
What kind of help did you need?
What’s up, Beast?
Oh hey, Beast. Did you need something?
I’m listening, Beast.
Jesus christ… I need… a medkit…
Oh, thank God… Wait a second. Where am I?
Well, have you ever heard of a space bubble?
Yeah. Why?
God really decided to supremely fuck you in particular today.
I knew I shouldn’t have flown today… The cloud-level anomaly maps were never reliable. Fucking colonel… Whatever. I’ll curse him and his god damn family later. Where’s the way out of here?
We don’t know yet. Were you flying with a crew in tow?
Yeah, but if the ’copter crashed, they’re probably ground beef right now. Anomaly toasted the control mechanism; the blades straight up melted too.
Hmm… Well, in any case, you should take it easy. Try not to push yourself too much, or that medkit will have gone to waste.
All right… Wait, look around for my rifle. It should be nearby.
You need something, Beast?
Holy fuck… I might be finished…
Hold on, hold on! I can save you!
Please, hurry…
You’ll live. I’ve seen people bounce back from worse. Let me stabilize you with a medkit, and I’ll bring you back to the medic back at base.
Holy fuck! Okay! Whatever! Just make this god damn pain stop!
Here. Use this.
Shit, let me find a medkit. There was one nearby…
default text
